Blade of Baz Preview 2.name: Blade of Baz
Blade of Baz Preview 2.author: Jillian Plomin
synposis: Ryan and Erica are typical high school students—or so they
think. They have hobbies and homework and friends, and are
generally normal siblings. But one October evening, they
find a curious object that rips them from their cozy suburban
home into a world of rebels, royals, legends, and swords. The
pair now have to find their way back from the strange land of
Aulmagne, but in doing so they ignite chaos and rebellion in
the Aulmagnian people, upsetting the tyrannical rule of
Chancellor Ulrich. Will Ryan and Erica ever make it home,
or are they trapped in this world forever?
section 2 preview: "So as I understand it, you found a sword that transported you
here when you both had hold of it? Hm. That sounds…magical."
"Pretty much, yeah. It’s crazy, I know."
"Not crazy, but…rare, certainly. Do you still have this
enchanted sword?"
"Yeah, I have it right over here." Ryan retrieved the sword
from the den and brought it to Owen, whose eyes grew into
saucers at the sight of it.
Owen stared, incredulous. "Do you have any idea what this is?"
"No, I just said that. We literally found it in a wall
yesterday."
"I think…I think that could be the Blade of Baz," he murmured
the words with reverence. "I’ve seen artwork depicting it
throughout the ages. It’s absolutely stunning. May I?" Owen
held out his hand and Ryan gave him the sword.
Owen cradled the blade and hilt on his fingertips, examining
the markings that ran along the blade.
"It’s just as the books describe it. Amazing…"
"So…you know something about this thing?" Ryan asked.
"It’s a legendary piece of weaponry, to be sure, passed down
a line of Kings throughout all of Gaeltach’s history…would
you like to hear the Legend of the Blade of Baz?"
Ryan scratched his head and shot a sideways glance at Erica.
"Uh, I guess, sure."
Owen grinned as he moved to stand in front of the twins,
almost like a performer on a stage.
"In the days of The First War, Queen Meda of Gaeltach traveled
through the treacherous mountains on the western border of the
country, bearing with her three carts pulled by six unicorns.
The carts were full of gold, silver, and jewels. They were gifts
for the King of the Goblins that ruled in the land beyond the
mountains.
"When Queen Meda arrived in the court of the Goblin King, she
was welcomed with a grand banquet. After three days and three
nights of festivities, the Queen had beguiled the Goblin King
with her soft voice and piercing eyes, and the Goblin King was
so taken with her that he offered to grant her any request. The
Queen asked for a weapon stronger and more powerful than any in
Gaeltach, that she may bring it back as a gift for her husband
Baz. The Goblin King happily obliged, for in the land of the
Goblins lie metals stronger than any other known in the world,
and the artisans and steelsmiths of the Goblins are unsurpassed
in skill."
"The Goblin King, desiring to impress Queen Meda, charged his
best bladesmith to forge a blade the like of which had never
before been created, and he took some of the jewels the Queen
had brought from Gaeltach to be embedded in the hilt, so as to
be forever known as belonging to the land of the Gaels. The
bladesmith worked many days to produce the gift the Queen would
bestow to her King, and when she offered it to Baz he was
greatly pleased."
At that, Owen’s expression changed from a far off look,
to an expectant one.
"That was…" Ryan searched for the right word,
"Poetic."
Then, steering the conversation back on course,
Ryan said, "So…Is there any chance this thing
can get us back to New York?"
"Well to start, I don’t know that there’s any chance it
brought you here. I’ve read a hundred history books that
mention the Blade of Baz, yet never any mention of
enchantment. There is a tremendous tale about when it was
lost, as well, and a great many accounts of famous deaths
it has caused. But, there’s nothing written about this
sword to indicate it has the power to transport people.
Also, I’m not familiar with this land, New York.
You must have traveled very far indeed."
